snippet: As Greece’s economy plunges and unemployment rises, many Greeks are fleeing to the countryside and looking to the nation’s rich agricultural past as a guide to the future.
abstract: Greeks fleeing to the countryside are looking to nation's rich rural past as a guide to the future, as Greece's blighted economy plunges further into the abyss; unemployment is now 18 percent, rising to 35 percent for young people, but the agricultural sector has been one of the few to show gains in employment since crisis hit.
lead_paragraph: As Greece’s economy plunges and unemployment rises, many Greeks are fleeing to the countryside and looking to the nation’s rich agricultural past as a guide to the future.

headline.seo: Amid Economic Strife, Greeks Look to Farming Past
headline.main: With Work Scarce in Athens, Greeks Go Back to the Land
headline.print_headline: With Work Scarce in Athens, Greeks Go Back to the Land
